CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, Sep. 24, 1955, pg. 6 reads: "Scholarship Winners - Six District boys and girls were awarded State Senatorial Scholarships at a dinner and dance and testimonial to David E. Glavin, deputy secretary of Labor and Industry for Pennsylvania, which was held at the Hotel William Penn, Saturday night...Miss Burleigh is the first Negro to win one of the scholarships during the four years that the CLU has sponsored the contest...the Misses [Audrey J.] Kaczorowska, [Betty Lou] Burleigh, and [Nancy Marie] Curran...Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of three women; Audrey J. Kaczorowska, Betty Lou Burleigh, and Nancy Marie Curran wearing a striped dress and corsage on left shoulder, seated in William Penn Hotel
